metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14767 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Kamailio before 5.0.7 and 5.1.x before 5.1.4, a crafted SIP message with a double "To" header and an empty "To" tag causes a segmentation fault and crash. The reason is missing input validation in the "build_res_buf_from_sip_req" core function. This could result in denial of service and potentially the execution of arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

kamailio - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-autheph-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-berkeley-bin - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-berkeley-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-cnxcc-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-cpl-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-erlang-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-extra-modules - 5.2.1-1
kamailio-geoip-modules - 5.2.1-1

kamailio-ims-modules - 5.2.1-1

criterions.comment: kamailio package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.1-1').
